results.title: Alice
results.creator_credit: Jan Svankmajer, Peter-Christian Fueter, Condor Features, Film Four International and Hessischer Rundfunk
results.brief_description: In a wonderland populated by an array of superbly animated puppets, steaks crawl, rolls sprout nails and Alice (the only human in the film), not only shrinks, but becomes her own doll. Czech surrealist Jan Svankmajer’s definitive version of “Alice’s adventures in Wonderland” is a distinctive vision which remains true to the absurd and menacing spirit of Lewis Carroll’s work.

constellations_other.name: Bring me to life
constellations_other.description: From the imaginative children’s show Lift Off!, explore the various ways dolls and puppets are connected and come to life on screen.

results.title: All dogs go to heaven
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman, John Pomeroy and Sullivan Bluth Studios Ireland
results.brief_description: Don Bluth, the acclaimed animator of “An American Tail” transports us into a wonderful world of animals and adventure. Featuring the voices of Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise and Loni Anderson. Charlie is a rascal but a hero nevertheless. This canine rogue’s michievious streak gets him into serious trouble until he learns the value of friendship and goodness.

results.title: All about music
results.creator_credit: Fred Calvert, Farmhouse Films and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Provides, through the use of animation, an introduction to the origins and basic elements of music. Tells the story of a caveman and his discovery of rhythm, melody, and harmony. Highlights, with live action inserts, prehistoric contributions to the development of music, including modern music.

results.title: Aliens (Captioned) (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd, Brandywine Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Alien, the perfect organism. A killing machine whose physical excellence is matched only by its hostility. Officer Ellen Ripley and the crew of the starship Nostromo encountered such a creature and she alone survived the massacre. After floating in space for years Ripley is rescued only to learn that she must return to the planet where her nightmare began. L.V. 426, the world where Ripley first encountered the Alien is now colonised. When communication is lost with the settlers, a team of battle hardened space marines is sent with Ripley and find not one creature, but thousands. The Alien is breeding, and this time it’s all-out war! This special edition is a version of “Aliens” which contains 17 minutes of extra footage restored to the original by the director, James Cameron. Cast includes Sigourney Weaver, Carrie Henn, Michael Biehn and Paul Reiser.

results.title: Alice in wonderland
results.creator_credit: Nick Willing, Dyson Lovell, Babelsberg International Film Produktion and Hallmark Entertainment
results.brief_description: After running away from home, Alice steps into a rabbit hole and enters an incredible magical world full of adventure. Originally produced for television, this adaptation of the Lewis Carroll classic features an impressive cast and special effects from Frame Store and Jim Henson’s Creature Shop. Cast includes Robbie Coltrane, Whoopi Goldberg, Ben Kingsley, Christopher Lloyd, Martin Short and many more.

results.title: Ali: the legend
results.brief_description: Documentary on boxing and sports legend Muhammad Ali, born Cassius Clay. Ali became a symbol of African American pride during, and after, his dominance of the sport during the 1960s and 70s. This work contains actual footage of events in Ali’s life - mostly extensive clips from lengthy bouts, including fights with George Foreman, several with Joe Frazier and numerous other boxers, many of whom Ali defeated. Also features clips of Ali in training; at press conferences; and relaxing and playing with his daughter. Includes some brief archival interviews (some audio only) with Ali and news footage from 1967 when Ali caused a furore by refusing to serve in the armed forces in Vietnam, due to his religion of Islam. At press conferences throughout his career Ali proved that he often cut an amusing, charismatic and inspirational figure.

results.title: Ali Baba
results.brief_description: An animated film presenting the tale of the little boy and the forty thieves with charmingly designed and coloured figures. Ali Baba’s discovery of the hidden treasure, how he keeps Mustafa and the thieves from recapturing it, and the lad’s generosity as he distributes the jewels among the townspeople is told with brief rhymed narration to the accompaniment of wind music. No other credits available.

results.title: Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: This program presents Alfred Hitchcock, the master of suspense, in a rare discussion of his film-making techniques and his illustrious 50 year career as a director. Filled with classic film clips, the program reveals that Hitchcock’s famous cinematic techniques for instilling suspense and terror were the result of his detailed planning of each scene at the script stage. Hitchcock’s career is reviewed with the use of selected film clips from his most famous movies and through the recollections of the stars who worked with him. Included are excerpts from “Psycho” with Anthony Perkins and Janet Leigh, “North by North West” with Cary Grant, and “Frenzy” with Jon Finch and Barry Foster.

results.title: Alfie
results.creator_credit: Lewis Gilbert and Sheldrake Films Ltd
results.brief_description: This wonderful comedy is the film that catapulted Michael Caine to stardom. Alfie (Caine) is not really a bad sort. He’s just a philandering cockney playboy who has this overwhelming desire for the opposite sex. What’s more, he likes to brag about his conquests, and he doesn’t have to exaggerate, because Alfie gets them all; fat, thin, blonde, brunette, young and even the older ‘richer’ woman. He’s just irresistible, no one can beat him at the mating game! This is Michael Caine at his chauvinistic best. Also stars Shelly Winters as Ruby. Based on the play by Bill Naughton.
